description: '''Laïko'''{{efn|{{ublist|{{IPAc-en|lang|l|aɪ|ˈ|k|oʊ}} {{respell|ly-KOH}}|{{langx|el|λαϊκό [τραγούδι]|laïkó {{noitalics|[}}tragoúdi{{noitalics|]}}|link=no}}, {{IPA|el|lai̯ˈko tɾaˈɣuði|pron}}; {{small|{{abbr|pl.|plural form}}}} {{lang|el|λαϊκά [τραγούδια]}}, {{translit|el|laïká {{noitalics|[}}tragoúdia{{noitalics|]}}}}, {{IPA|el|lai̯ˈka tɾaˈɣuði̯a|IPA}}}}}}{{efn|The term ''laïkó tragoúdi'' can be translated as 'song of the people' or 'popular song'. The word ''laïkó'' is the neuter form of the Greek word ''laïkós'' ({{lang|el|λαϊκός}}), meaning 'popular, folk'.}} is a Greek [[folk-pop]] music genre. Also referred to as a "folk song", or "urban folk music"{{efn|{{lang|el|αστική λαϊκή μουσική}}, {{translit|el|astikí laïkí mousikí}}, {{IPA|el|as̠tiˈci lai̯ˈci mus̠iˈci|IPA}}}} in its plural form, Laïkó changed forms over the decades after the [[commercialization]] of [[Rebetiko]] music.
